CatDescriptText: Mr. Leroy Brown, bandleader, 2141 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "No question in my mind that these FEPC laws have not helped Negroes to get jobs. I would say, though, that preparedness is the solution to our job problem."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Leroy Brown wearing dark hat, moustache, and light colored short sleeved shirt with paisley collar and trim, standing in front of brick wall with graffiti inscribed "Richard Sm... Rosible..."
